column4: Question for anyone with a netbook. I am running a EEEPC and running a dual boot of Ubuntu 8.10 and XP. 8.10 Runs fine but runs a little slow for me. I figured I would try eeebuntu before I just reinstall with xfce. But eeebuntu just goes straight to a command prompt but not logged in as a user. How can I tell Ubuntu to copy an ISO to usb? (Newish to linux)
On an Aspire One**
system->admin->create a usb startup disk u mean?
Yes, I wanna try the eeebuntu cause I have been told it works really well with the aspire one but the unetbootin program won't load the iso properly to the usb
but when I try to make a usb boot of it in linux it brings me to some kind of odd terminal
busybox probably/
yup busybox
i dunno really all i can suggest is that menu item for creatig a usb startup disk.  i know nothing beyond that.  sorry
is there a way to tell busy box to install the usb boot? I haven't used linux in 8 years (last time was slackware so I kinda rusty)
busybox is there because there's a problem.  busybox is "all it can give you"....so it falls back on it
and busybox is very limited
ok. I have heard of a way via called isotostick.sh. Have you ever heard of this?
nope is there a guide url where you see that file?
Googled eeebuntu usb. But can't find instructions on how to get the file just the command of sudo sh ./isotostick.sh ./[ISO FILE].iso /dev/sdb
oh so you need the file isotostick.sh
I am going to lean towards yes.
http://startx.ro/sugar/
Thank you so much.
all i really did was punch it into gooogle
The funny thing is I punched it in google and got like no results...
ya the 2nd one looks like an ftp and those usually have the goodies.... u can recognize them
Thank you. I am going to try this and see if I can get eeebuntu to install and I will rejoin if it works hopefully :)
